intro: Rondeletia brilliantissima, commonly known as the golden rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy texture, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
